member.name: T:Enyim.HashkitCrc32
member.summary: CRC-32 implementation. Compatible with libhashkit.

member.name: T:Enyim.HashkitMurmur
member.summary: Murmur hash. Uses the same seed values as libhashkit.
member.remarks: Does not support block based hashing.

member.name: T:Enyim.HashkitOneAtATime
member.summary:
This is Jenkin's "One at A time Hash". http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jenkins_hash_function
Coming from libhashkit.
member.remarks: Does not support block based hashing.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.Operations.Text.TextProtocol.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources allocated by this instance
member.remarks: Technically it's not really neccesary to call this, since the client does not create "really" disposable objects, so it's safe to assume that when the AppPool shuts down all resources will be released correctly and no handles or such will remain in the memory.

member.name: T:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode
member.summary: Represents a Memcached node in the pool.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.Ping
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the server is working or not.
If the server is not working, and the "being dead" timeout has been expired it will reinitialize itself.
member.remarks: It's possible that the server is still not up & running so the next call to could mark the instance as dead again.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.Acquire
member.summary: Acquires a new item from the pool
member.returns: An instance which is connected to the memcached server, or null if the pool is dead.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources allocated by this instance

member.name: P:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.EndPoint
member.summary: Gets the of this instance

member.name: P:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.IsAlive

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the server is working or not. Returns a cached state.
To get real-time information and update the cached state, use the method.

member.remarks: Used by the to quickly check if the server's state is valid.

member.name: F:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.InternalPoolImpl.freeItems
member.summary: A list of already connected but free to use sockets

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.InternalPoolImpl.Acquire
member.summary: Acquires a new item from the pool
member.returns: An instance which is connected to the memcached server, or null if the pool is dead.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.InternalPoolImpl.ReleaseSocket(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket)
member.summary: Releases an item back into the pool

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedNode.InternalPoolImpl.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources allocated by this instance

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.Operations.Text.TextSocketHelper.ReadResponse(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket)
member.summary: Reads the response of the server.
member.returns: The data sent by the memcached server.
member.exception: The server did not sent a response or an empty line was returned.
The server did not specified any reason just returned the string ERROR. - or - The server returned a SERVER_ERROR, in this case the Message of the exception is the message returned by the server.
The server did not recognize the request sent by the client. The Message of the exception is the message returned by the server.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.Operations.Text.TextSocketHelper.ReadLine(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket)
member.summary: Reads a line from the socket. A line is terninated by \r\n.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.Operations.Text.TextSocketHelper.SendCommand(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket,System.String)
member.summary: Sends the command to the server. The trailing \r\n is automatically appended.
member.param: The command to be sent to the server.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.Operations.Text.TextSocketHelper.GetCommandBuffer(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the bytes representing the specified command. returned buffer can be used to streamline multiple writes into one Write on the Socket using the
member.param: The command to be converted.
member.returns: The buffer containing the bytes representing the command. The returned buffer will be terminated with 13, 10 (\r\n)
member.remarks: The Nagle algorithm is disabled on the socket to speed things up, so it's recommended to convert a command into a buffer and use the to send the command and the additional buffers in one transaction.

member.name: T:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.SingleNodeLocator
member.summary: This is a simple node locator with no computation overhead, always returns the first server from the list. Use only in single server deployments.

summary.para: Implements a very fast object factory for dynamic object creation. Dynamically generates a factory class which will use the new() constructor of the requested type.
Much faster than using Activator at the price of the first invocation being significantly slower than subsequent calls.

member.name: M:Enyim.Reflection.FastActivator.CreateInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type using a generated factory to avoid using Reflection.
member.param: The type to be created
member.returns: The newly created instance.

member.name: M:Enyim.Reflection.FastActivator.CreateInstance(System.Type,System.Type[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type using a generated factory to avoid using Reflection. It will use the constructor which has the specified type of arguments.
member.param: The type to be created.
The types of the contructor parameters.
The arguments used to initialize the new instance.
member.returns: The newly created instance.

member.name: M:Enyim.Reflection.FastActivator.CreateInstance``1
member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type using a generated factory to avoid using Reflection.
member.returns: The newly created instance.

member.name: M:Enyim.Reflection.FastActivator.CreateInstance``1(System.Type[],System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type using a generated factory to avoid using Reflection. It will use the constructor which has the specified type of arguments.
member.param: The types of the contructor parameters.
The arguments used to initialize the new instance.
member.returns: The newly created instance.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new MemcachedClient instance using the default configuration section (enyim/memcached).

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new MemcachedClient instance using the specified configuration section. This overload allows to create multiple MemcachedClients with different pool configurations.
member.param: The name of the configuration section to be used for configuring the behavior of the client.

member.param: The client configuration.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the using a custom server pool implementation.

The authentication provider this client should use. If null, the connections will not be authenticated.

member.summary: Retrieves the specified item from the cache.

member.returns: The retrieved item, or null if the key was not found.

member.summary: Retrieves the specified item from the cache.

member.returns: The retrieved item, or default(T) if the key was not found.

member.summary: Tries to get an item from the cache.

The retrieved item or null if not found.
member.returns: The true if the item was successfully retrieved.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Store(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreMode,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: Defines how the item is stored in the cache.
The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
member.remarks: The item does not expire unless it is removed due memory pressure.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Store(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreMode,System.String,System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: Defines how the item is stored in the cache.
The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
The interval after the item is invalidated in the cache.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Store(Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreMode,System.String,System.Object,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Inserts an item into the cache with a cache key to reference its location.
member.param: Defines how the item is stored in the cache.
The key used to reference the item.
The object to be inserted into the cache.
The time when the item is invalidated in the cache.
member.returns: true if the item was successfully stored in the cache; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Increment(System.String,System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server.
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The value which will be stored by the server if the specified item was not found.
The amount by which the client wants to increase the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or defaultValue if the key was not found.
member.remarks: If the client uses the Text protocol, the item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. It must be inserted as a . Moreover the Text protocol only works with values, so return value -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.remarks: If the client uses the Text protocol, the item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. It must be inserted as a . Moreover the Text protocol only works with values, so return value -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.returns: true if the item was successfully removed from the cache; false otherwise.

member.summary: Retrieves multiple items from the cache.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.MemcachedClient.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources allocated by this instance
member.remarks: Technically it's not really neccesary to call this, since the client does not create "really" disposable objects, so it's safe to assume that when the AppPool shuts down all resources will be released correctly and no handles or such will remain in the memory.

member.name: F:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.InstanceId
member.summary: The ID of this instance. Used by the to identify the instance in its inner lists.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.Destroy
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this instance and shuts down the inner . This instance will not be usable anymore.
member.remarks: Use the IDisposable.Dispose method if you want to release this instance back into the pool.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads the next byte from the server's response.
member.remarks: This method blocks and will not return until the value is read.

member.name: M:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.PooledSocket.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads data from the server into the specified buffer.
member.param: An array of that is the storage location for the received data.
The location in buffer to store the received data.
The number of bytes to read.
member.remarks: This method blocks and will not return until the specified amount of bytes are read.

The name of the stat value

member.summary: Store the data, but only if the server does already hold data for a given key

member.name: F:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreMode.Set
member.summary: Store the data, overwrite if already exist

member.summary: Store the data, but only if the server does not already hold data for a given key

member.name: F:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreCommand.Replace
member.summary: Store the data, but only if the server does already hold data for a given key

member.summary: Store the data, overwrite if already exist

member.name: F:Enyim.Caching.Memcached.StoreCommand.CheckAndSet
member.summary: Stores the data only if it has not been updated by someone else. Uses a "transaction id" to check for modification.

member.name: T:Enyim.TigerHash
member.summary:
Implements the Tiger hash. (http://www.cs.technion.ac.il/~biham/Reports/Tiger/)
Ported (and cleaned&sped up) from the Tiger.NET VB code. (http://www.hotpixel.net/software.html)

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes an instance of .

member.summary: Routes data written to the object into the hash algorithm for computing the hash.
member.param: The input data.
The offset into the byte array from which to begin using data.
The number of bytes in the array to use as data.

member.name: M:Enyim.TigerHash.HashFinal
member.summary: Returns the computed hash value after all data has been written to the object.
member.returns: The computed hash code.
